regulations.name: Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR)
regulations.description: The FAR is the principal set of rules in the Federal Acquisition Regulations System regarding government procurement in the United States.
regulations.application: Ensures that the purchasing process for government contracts is conducted fairly and transparently.

regulations.name: Uniform Commercial Code (UCC)
regulations.description: A comprehensive set of laws governing all commercial transactions in the United States.
regulations.application: Applies to the sale of goods and ensures that contracts are enforceable and fair.

regulations.name: Environmental Protection Act
regulations.description: Regulates the impact of business operations on the environment.
regulations.application: Ensures that the purchasing decision complies with environmental standards and sustainability practices.

compliance_checklist: Step 1: Review the Federal Acquisition Regulation to ensure all procurement processes meet federal standards.
Step 2: Verify that all contracts comply with the Uniform Commercial Code to ensure enforceability.
Step 3: Conduct an environmental impact assessment to ensure compliance with the Environmental Protection Act.
Step 4: Document all procurement decisions and maintain records for audit purposes.
Step 5: Ensure all suppliers are vetted for compliance with relevant labor and safety regulations.
